message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.SY 

The paper proposes a method for performing efficient approximate inference on discrete graphical models using Stein variational gradient descent (SVGD), which is a popular method in machine learning for continuous distributions. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) since these sub-categories often deal with probabilistic models and inference methods. The paper also introduces a transform that can be used for goodness-of-fit (GOF) tests on discrete distributions, which suggests that it could also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SY (Systems and Control).
